reviewText: This is one of the best brit series I've seen since "Upstairs, Downstairs" so many years ago. And it actually has some things in common with that venerable high-class 'soap.' Great storytelling and fascinating characters on both sides of the prison bars that you come to care about as if they are very real people indeed.Not only is this series a 'best-kept secret' on this side of the Atlantic...I thought I was always up on brit tv thanks to PBS, etc. but I had never heard of this series until quite recently and it's been running for almost 8 years! ...also virtually unknown over here is one of the best british actresses I've seen lately, the divine Simone Lahbib. An actress of rare nuance and sensuality who makes the admirable and, at times, maddening Helen Stewart one of the most fascinating and complex characters I've ever enjoyed watching in any series. Who knew a scottish accent could be so sexy?Lahbib and the superb Mandana Jones as lifer Nikki Wade who is serving time for killing the corrupt copper who was trying to sexually assault her girlfriend have a chemistry together that transcends most working relationships and borders on telepathic. They make sparks. This is one of the most romantic, despite its setting, and angsty, because of its setting, love stories ever filmed for tv. Such a welcome alternative to the sheer silly weirdness into which "The L Word" has descended.The Love Story is the Heart of the first 3 seasons (I had to send to the UK for series 2 & 3 and get a region-free dvd player in order to watch...and I wanted to see it that badly...and it was bloody well worth it) but the other reviewer is correct, all the characters and storylines are fascinating and the acting uniformly superb across the board. I heard of this series, finally, and wanted to watch because of the lesbian love story, but everything else about it engaged my attention and emotions as well.Jack Ellis as Jim Fenner is one of the great screen villains.With a title like "Bad Girls" in this day and age I expected sleaze, like the Aussie soap about women in prison from several years back, but instead I got an insightful, down-to-earth, well-written, beautifully acted program, especially in the stellar first two, less melodramatic, seasons.And, again, the luscious Lahbib is worth watching in anything.
summary: Don't let the title scare you
Title: N/A

reviewText: So now we have the female version of"OZ"..."OZ"of course was the american cable soap opera show about a bunch of notorious scum,which treated these losers in such a way as to make thier rotten lives,twisted morality and worthless goals palatable..Of course the"critics"loved this show,but then again the"critics"seem to love anything that is not decent,or made for the mainstream audience...This is why the"People's Choice"awards differ so greatly from the other "professionals-only"awards shows,like the oscars.."Bad girls"is merely an"OZ"retread,only this time around the losers are females...The plots are much the same..the same sort of bottom-feeder losers,only this time they have jiggle...The same sort of rotten lives,the same sort of twisted goals,the same worthlessness of charecter...Most of the charecters in both "OZ" and "Bad Girls"ought to be put to death rather than glorified on a teevee series.."Oz" and this garbage are poster examples of why there ought to be a death penalty that is universal and immediate upon conviction...One can only wonder what bottom of the barrel group our"entertainment"industry will glorify next?Maybe some enterprising,and perverted,mind out there is even now writing the pilot script for "A year with Adolf,Eva,Goebbels,Himmler,the concentration camps & you",in which the nazis are seen as just plain folks,misunderstood in thier race-baiting and thier mass exterminations...Why not?Every other bottom-feeder group seems to be getting a cable soap opera show that seeks to portray them in other than realistic terms,so why not the Nazis?And after the nazis,can the inquisition,or the Armenian genocide be far behind?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Both Bad Girls & Prisoner are finally on DVD in the states & it's so nice for those living in America who've not previously seen both shows to get a dose of the controversial drama depicted in these series & in essence, becoming fans of these cult classics.Bad Girls seems to still be going strong in the UK, so that in itself proves the program is durable & successful.  If you love gritty prison melodrama, I strongly recommend Bad Girls along with PCBH.Now hopefully this Season will sell well & additional seasons will soon become available on this side of the pond.  I've seen this series (& future seasons) & it is impossible to stop at season 1, Bad Girls is too engrossing & has had some spine-tingling cliffhangers for sure.
summary: Great companion to Prisoner Cell Block H
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this set as a blind buy - I had never heard of the series before.  I can not stress enough how great a show this is.  The acting is first rate; the storytelling top notch; and characterization some of the best I've seen.  Not to give anything away, but there is a character ("Shell" Dockley)that makes Tony Soprano seem like Mother Teresa.  If you enjoy topnotch drama please give this series a try.  I liked it so much that I bought the rest of the series (six season out so far) from Amazon.co.uk along with a region free DVD Player to watch it with. Again pick this up you will not be disapointed.
summary: Bad Girls Makes For Great TV
Title: N/A

reviewText: I started watching this show on Logo and became so addicted I ordered the first 3 seasons from Amazon UK along with a $50 Region Free DVD player from Amazon US.I agree with the majority of reveiws that state that this is a great show.  To those who say it's not realistic....IT'S A TV SHOW!!! It's not supposed to be.  Do you really want to sit and watch people who have an hour or so of association a day sitting in their cells?  I don't think so.The writing and acting are awesome and the show does exactly what TV is supposed to do...it entertains you.
summary: Since when is TV supposed to be realistic?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Those who have read my reviews know that I'm not just a harsh critic...I can be down-right vicious.However...when I love something I really unleash with the praise.This series is absolutely one of the best television shows ever produced for British and God knows American television.  It never talks down to the viewer and keeps you riveted with the intelligent relationships and drama.People say OZ was the best prison show ever...I politely disagree.Bad Girls is one of the most intelligent and provacative shows ever produced.Buy it, you won't be sorry.PS- They actually treat a lesbian relationship with dignity!  Go figure.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just over a decade since ITV started screening the long-running Australian prison drama, Prisoner: Cell Block H, ITV commissioned their own weekly drama set in a women's jail. Produced by Shed Productions, this first series consisits of ten episodes and originally aired in summer 1999.Bad Girls would go on to run for eight series and prove to be a weekly ratings winner for the network. These ten episodes introduce us to the inmates and staff of HMP Larkhall and are well worth a watch (or re-watch).Enjoy the set!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Feeding my mind lately with BBC television series, I gave this one a try expecting the worst with title, but got a shock at how seriously brilliant this series is.  If you're watching to catch some women getting it on, you're truly missing what makes this show so great: the storylines, the storylines, the storylines.  One of the best moments, for me, is when the women in G block get guitars and try to learn "Kumbaya" to annoy the screws in order they get their open visits back - after having them taken away for overt drug use reported in a local paper.  I have found my new crack and can't wait until the next seasons become available in America.
Title: N/A
